metadata.name: Lifetime Journey
metadata.description:
Whales are definitely my favorite animal in the whole world, probably because since I was little I remember seeing them every year making their way around the coasts of my beautiful hometown in Mexico.

Since I started flying drones, I have tried to capture this beautiful moment, however, it is not an easy task.

There I was, in one of my favorite places on the outskirts of the city, on the side of the Pacific coast highway ready to get my long-awaited photograph, I had time observing them from a high point and I knew that this would be the day.

It may seem like a simple task, but once the drone is airborne in the middle of the vast ocean, it's like looking for a needle in a haystack.

If the camera is at a 45 degree angle and it's a sunny day like it was, all you'll see is the reflection of the sun. So what I had to do was fly with the camera facing completely downwards and against the sun and after having used up 3 batteries in the attempt, 1.5 kilometers away from the coast and almost depleted the fourth battery I had a brief but precious moment to get the desired photos, I didn't know if my drone would make the way back but it was worth the try. 

You can imagine my surprise when I saw the footage once I landed. A moment I will remember forever but that definitely will try to repeat every year from now on.

100% of the sale will be donated to protect and preserve ocean wildlife.
